str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: From epi and erchomai; to supervene, i.e. Arrive, occur, impend, attack, influence.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
